item.text:
The next set of questions help provide comprehensive evaluation. 
They require about 2 minutes. These queastions were developed by the National Institutes of Health Task Force on Research Standards
 for Chronic Low Back Pain. They are essential for comparing outcomes of patients with low back pain.

code.display: How long has back pain been an ongoing problem for you?

item.text: How long has back pain been an ongoing problem for you?

This question was developed by the National Institutes of Health Task Force on Research Standards for Chronic Low Back Pain. Your response helps determine if results of research on back pain apply to you.

code.display: How often has back pain been an ongoing problem for you?

item.text: How often has back pain been an ongoing problem for you?

valueCoding.display: Every day or nearly every day

item.text: This question was developed by the National Institutes of Health Task Force on Research Standards for Chronic Low Back Pain. Your response helps determine if results of research on back pain apply to you.

code.display: Do you have pain down your leg?

item.text: Do you have pain down your leg?

valueCoding.display: Yes, only on the left side

item.text: This question was developed by the National Institutes of Health Task Force on Research Standards for Chronic Low Back Pain. Your response helps determine if results of research on back pain apply to you.

code.display: Have you had pain, numbness or tingling below your knee?

item.text: Have you had pain, numbness or tingling below your knee?

valueCoding.display: Yes, only on the left side

item.text: This question was developed by the National Institutes of Health Task Force on Research Standards for Chronic Low Back Pain. Your response helps determine if results of research on back pain apply to you.

code.display: Have you ever had a low-back operation?

item.text: Have you ever had a low-back operation?

This question was developed by the National Institutes of Health Task Force on Research Standards for Chronic Low Back Pain. Your response helps determine if results of research on back pain apply to you.

code.display: When was your last back operation?

item.text: When was your last back operation?

This question was developed by the National Institutes of Health Task Force on Research Standards for Chronic Low Back Pain. Your response helps determine if results of research on back pain apply to you.

code.display: Did any of your back operations involve a spinal fusion? (also called an arthrodesis)

item.text: Did any of your back operations involve a spinal fusion? (also called an arthrodesis)

This question was developed by the National Institutes of Health Task Force on Research Standards for Chronic Low Back Pain. Your response helps determine if results of research on back pain apply to you.

code.display: Have you ever had low back injection (such as epidural steroid injection, facet injection)?

item.text: Have you ever had low back injection (such as epidural steroid injection, facet injection)?

This question was developed by the National Institutes of Health Task Force on Research Standards for Chronic Low Back Pain. Your response helps determine if results of research on back pain apply to you.
When was your last injection?

This question was developed by the National Institutes of Health Task Force on Research Standards for Chronic Low Back Pain. Your response helps determine if results of research on back pain apply to you.

code.display: Have you ever had physical therapy for your back?

item.text: Have you ever had physical therapy for your back?

valueCoding.display: Yes, more than one series of treatments

item.text: This question was developed by the National Institutes of Health Task Force on Research Standards for Chronic Low Back Pain. Your response helps determine if results of research on back pain apply to you.
When was your last session?

This question was developed by the National Institutes of Health Task Force on Research Standards for Chronic Low Back Pain. Your response helps determine if results of research on back pain apply to you.

code.display: Have you ever used opioid pain killers? (prescription medications such as Vicodin, Lortab, Norco, hydrocodone, codeine, Tylenol #3 or #4, Fentanyl, Duragesic, MS Contin, Percocet, Tylox, OxyContin, oxycodone, methadone, tramadol, Ultram, Dilaudid)?

item.text: Have you ever used opioid pain killers? (prescription medications such as Vicodin, Lortab, Norco, hydrocodone, codeine, Tylenol #3 or #4, Fentanyl, Duragesic, MS Contin, Percocet, Tylox, OxyContin, oxycodone, methadone, tramadol, Ultram, Dilaudid)?

This question was developed by the National Institutes of Health Task Force on Research Standards for Chronic Low Back Pain. Your response helps determine if results of research on back pain apply to you.

code.display: Are you using these medications currently?

item.text: Are you using these medications currently?

This question was developed by the National Institutes of Health Task Force on Research Standards for Chronic Low Back Pain. Your response helps determine if results of research on back pain apply to you.

code.display: Have you ever had psychological counseling for pain coping skills, such as cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT)?

item.text: Have you ever had psychological counseling for pain coping skills, such as cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT)?

This question was developed by the National Institutes of Health Task Force on Research Standards for Chronic Low Back Pain. Your response helps determine if results of research on back pain apply to you.

code.display: Have you had to take time off work?

item.text: Have you had to take time off work?
The National Institutes of Health Task Force on Research Standards for Chronic Low Back Pain recommended this question as part of the minimum data set for back pain.
Have you applied for disability?

valueCoding.display: Yes, both workers comp and social security

item.text: The National Institutes of Health Task Force on Research Standards for Chronic Low Back Pain recommended this question as part of the minimum data set for back pain.

valueExpression.name: any_questions_answered
valueExpression.expression: %bp1_value.exists() or %bp2_value.exists() or %bp3_value.exists() or %bp4_value.exists() or %bp5_value.exists() or %bp6_value.exists() or %bp7_value.exists() or %bp8_value.exists() or %bp9_value.exists() or %bp10_value.exists() or %bp11_value.exists() or %bp12_value.exists() or %bp13_value.exists() or %bp14_value.exists() or %bp15_value.exists() or %bp16_value.exists()

iif(%any_questions_answered, iif(%bp1_value.exists(), %bp1_value, 0) + iif(%bp2_value.exists(), %bp2_value, 0) + iif(%bp3_value.exists(), %bp3_value, 0) + iif(%bp4_value.exists(), %bp4_value, 0) + iif(%bp5_value.exists(), %bp5_value, 0) + iif(%bp6_value.exists(), %bp6_value, 0) + iif(%bp7_value.exists(), %bp7_value, 0) + iif(%bp8_value.exists(), %bp8_value, 0) + iif(%bp9_value.exists(), %bp9_value, 0) + iif(%bp10_value.exists(), %bp10_value, 0) + iif(%bp11_value.exists(), %bp11_value, 0) + iif(%bp12_value.exists(), %bp12_value, 0) + iif(%bp13_value.exists(), %bp13_value, 0) + iif(%bp14_value.exists(), %bp14_value, 0) + iif(%bp15_value.exists(), %bp15_value, 0) + iif(%bp16_value.exists(), %bp16_value, 0), {})

item.text: Back Pain History Score
